data.enText: to tear sth or to become torn, often suddenly or violently

data.chText: 我的牛仔裤在栅栏上划破了。
data.enText: I ripped my jeans on the fence.
The flags had been ripped in two.
She ripped the letter open .

data.chText: 我听到了帐篷撕裂的声音。
data.enText: I heard the tent rip.
to remove sth quickly or violently, often by pulling it
He ripped off his tie.

data.chText: 地毯已经从楼梯上拖走了。
data.enText: The carpet had been ripped from the stairs.
let rip (at sb)

data.chText: 激动地说（或做）；忘乎所以地说（或做）
data.enText: to speak or do sth with great force, enthusiasm, etc. and without control

data.chText: 当她生男朋友气的时候，她真的对他破口大骂。
data.enText: When she gets angry with her boyfriend, she really lets rip at him.

data.chText: 乐队充满激情地表演了他们新唱片中的一首单曲。
data.enText: The group let rip with a single from their new album.
let rip
let sth rip
to go or allow sth such as a car to go as fast as possible

data.chText: 一上空旷的公路，他就全速行驶。
data.enText: Once on the open road, he let rip.

data.chText: 来吧，史蒂夫——让车全速前进吧。
data.enText: Come on Steve─let her rip.
to do sth or to allow sth to happen as fast as possible

data.chText: 这又将导致急剧的通货膨胀。
data.enText: This would cause inflation to let rip again.
rip sb/sth apart/to shreds/to bits, etc.
to destroy sth; to criticize sb very strongly
tear/rip the heart out of sth
to destroy the most important part or aspect of sth
tear/rip sb limb from limb
to attack sb very violently
rip at sth
to attack sth violently, usually by tearing or cutting it
rip into sb (for/with sth)
to criticize sb and tell them that you are very angry with them
rip into/through sb/sth
to go very quickly and violently into or through sb/sth

data.chText: 一颗子弹穿透了他的肩头。
data.enText: A bullet ripped into his shoulder.
rip sb↔off
to cheat sb, by making them pay too much, by selling them sth of poor quality, etc.

data.chText: 游客抱怨被当地的出租车司机敲了竹杠。
data.enText: Tourists complain of being ripped off by local cab drivers.
rip sth↔off
to steal sth

data.chText: 盗贼破门而入，偷走了五台电脑。
data.enText: Thieves broke in and ripped off five computers.
rip sth↔up
to tear sth into small pieces

data.chText: 他把信撕碎，扔到炉子里。
data.enText: He ripped up the letter and threw it in the fire.
a long tear in cloth, paper, etc.

ex.chText: 我曾看见一个人把电话簿撕成了两半。
ex.enText: I once saw a man tear a telephone directory in half.

ex.chText: 他的外衣被钉子划破了。
ex.enText: His coat was torn on a nail.

ex.chText: 她生气地把书都撕破了。

synonyms.bx: 最普通用词，指有意或无意地把纸张、床单、衣服等撕裂。

ex.chText: 别撕包装，我还没付钱呢。
ex.enText: Don't rip the cover. I haven't paid yet.
The flag was ripped under the force of the wind.

ex.chText: 我要亲手把他撕成碎片。
ex.enText: I'll rip him apart with my hands.

synonyms.bx: 指猛然用力把布料等物撕开，也可指用粗暴手段把某物撕裂。

data.enText: let rip (at sb)

data.enText: This would cause inflation to let rip again.

to attack sth violently, usually by tearing or cutting it

to criticize sb and tell them that you are very angry with them

data.enText: A bullet ripped into his shoulder.

data.enText: He ripped up the letter and threw it in the fire.

trans: 敲…的竹杠；对…漫天要价；坑骗

tr: the act of rending or ripping or splitting something
example: he gave the envelope a vigorous rip

tr: a stretch of turbulent water in a river or the sea caused by one current flowing into or across another current
an opening made forcibly as by pulling apart
example: there was a rip in his pants
she had snags in her stockings

tr: a dissolute man in fashionable society
criticize or abuse strongly and violently
example: The candidate ripped into his opponent mercilessly
The curtain ripped from top to bottom
pull the cooked chicken into strips
The tornado ripped along the coast

value.def: When something rips or when you rip it, you tear it forcefully with your hands or with a tool such as a knife.

example.ex: I felt the banner rip as we were pushed in opposite directions...
example.tran: 当我们被推向相反的方向时，我感觉横幅被撕裂了。

example.ex: I tried not to rip the paper as I unwrapped it.
example.tran: 我把纸打开的时候，尽量不把它撕破。

value.tran: （使）撕开;（使）扯开;（使）撕裂;（使）划破

value.def: A rip is a long cut or split in something made of cloth or paper.

example.ex: Looking at the rip in her new dress, she flew into a rage.
example.tran: 看到新连衣裙上的口子，她勃然大怒。

value.def: If you rip something away, you remove it quickly and forcefully.

example.ex: He ripped away a wire that led to the alarm button...
example.tran: 他把连着报警按钮的电线扯掉了。

example.ex: She ripped off her dress and let it fall to the floor...
example.tran: 她一把扯下连衣裙，任其滑落到地上。

example.ex: He ripped the phone from her hand.
example.tran: 他把电话从她手中抢了过来。

value.def: If something rips into someone or something or rips through them, it enters that person or thing so quickly and forcefully that it often goes completely through them.

example.ex: A volley of bullets ripped into the facing wall...
example.tran: 一排子弹射进对面的墙上。

example.ex: Their minibus was ripped apart by a bomb...
example.tran: 他们的面包车被炸弹炸得粉碎。

example.ex: The fire ripped through the living room...
A violent streak of pain ripped through her whole body.
example.tran: 一阵剧烈的疼痛传遍了她的全身。

value.def: If you let rip, you do something forcefully and without trying to control yourself.

example.ex: Turn the guitars up full and let rip...
example.tran: 把吉他的音量调到最大，尽情欢乐吧。

example.ex: 'Yaaaaaaa,' Carla let rip with the cry of the Valkyries.
example.tran: “呀——”卡拉放开喉咙，发出女武神瓦尔基里一般的嘶喊声。

value.tran: 尽情地做;忘乎所以地做;用尽力气做

value.def: If you let something rip, you do it as quickly or as forcefully as possible. You can say 'let it rip' or 'let her rip' to someone when you want them to make a vehicle go as fast as it possibly can.

example.ex: The ecological disaster is partly a product of letting everything rip in order to increase production.
example.tran: 出现生态灾难的部分原因是人们为了增产而不惜一切代价。

value.tran: 迅速地做;强有力地做;(车辆)全速前进，开足马力

trans: 敲诈；敲…的竹杠；对…漫天要价；坑骗
埃塞斯廷；瑞普·埃塞斯廷；耶瑟斯庭
扯掉；狠狠地发出；偷窃；撕去；狠狠发出
迅速地做;强有力地做;(车辆)全速前进，开足马力
